description: Composite and every divisor (except 1) contains the digit 4.
example: 1849 has divisors 1, 43 and 1849, all of which contain the digit 4
mathematica: fQ[n_, dgt_] := Union[ MemberQ[#, dgt] & /@ IntegerDigits@ Rest@ Divisors@ n][[1]]; Select[ Range[2, 59500], !PrimeQ[#] && fQ[#, 4] &] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 11 2014 *)
author: _Erich Friedman_, Jul 04 2001
